did.unittitle: The Congregationalists in the War surveys, 1919.
did.abstract: An unknown congregationalist organization sent out surveys to many of the congregational churches across the contiguous 48 states to record levels of patriotism post World War I. These surveys contain details of congregational church participation and support of the American war efforts, and what their post war transition looked like.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Word War I, also known as The Great War, started in 1914 between the Allied forces (Great Britan and France) versus the Central Powers (Germany and Austria). America's eventual introduction into the war in 1917 helped lead to the Allied victory over the Central Powers in November of 1918. An unknown national congregational organization sent out surveys in early 1919 to potentially record levels of patriotism from the congregation. Many churches had provided support to the wartime efforts through time, money, or active service members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Congregationalist in the War surveys are a collection of surveys sent to Congregational churches across the contiguous 48 states post World War I. These surveys contain details of Congregational church participation and support of the American war efforts, and what their post war transition looked like. The two volumes are bound in alphabetical order by state and then city.
